result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF455 and 15CF388:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Curtis Steven Korn appeared. Case called at 8:34 a.m. Court notes this matter was set for a jury trial. Letter was received yesterday stating there is a resolution on both files. ADA McKinley recites recommendations. Atty Harrelson in agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine  in 14CF455 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine  in 14CF455. On motion of the State, Ct.2 in 14CF455 and file 15CF388 are read in and dismissed. Sentencing arguments. Atty Harrelson requesting expungement upon successful completion of probation. ADA McKinley objects to expungement but leaves it up to the court. 20 days to file appeal. Crt orders:

14CF455- Count 1:

-   S/W 3 years probation. Must report to probation by noon today. Bond will continue until reports to probation

  - Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-   Not to use or possess firearms or any weapons.

-   Court costs and DNA Surcharge. To be paid over the course of probation. 

-   DNA Sample

-  Upon successful completion of probation, court will grant expungement. DE must apply.
To RMW from Atty Harrelson stating Jury Trial can be removed from calendar and set for a plea. There is an agreement. hml
to Parties from RMW denying the motion for continuance of March 1, 2016 Jury Trial. hml

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF455 and 15CF388:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Curtis Steven Korn appeared. Case called at 10:00 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for trial 03-01-2016. ADA McKinley makes statement. New information has come forward and requesting a continuance. Atty Harrelson makes statement. Only objection to a continuance is that paperwork is pending in MN for a transport of a witness. Court requests ADA McKinley to put continuance request in writing and that will allow Atty Harrelson time to contact MN and file a response to State's continuance request. Court will then make a decision based on response from Atty Harrelson. Trial will stay on the calendar at this time. Court reviewed Atty Harrelson's Motion in Limine. Both parties have submitted witness lists, jury instructions and proposed verdicts. Neither party objects to questions by the jury. Court will allow note taking by the jurors. Atty Harrelson states that portion of the discovery demand by the state have not been met. That is the information from the state crime lab. Court asks attorneys work together that information requested that is per statute is exchanged. If the court needs to be involved, file a motion for review. Atty Harrelson has 24 hours to respond to State's continuance request.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF455 and 15CF388:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Curtis Steven Korn appeared. Case called at 11:05 a.m. ADA McKinley states no resolution at this time. Court suggests parties schedule jury and and final pre trial conference with JA. Motions will need to be filed no later than 7 days prior to final pre trial conference. Address confirmed. Bond continues.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF455 and 15CF388:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Curtis Steven Korn appeared. Case called at 1:41 p.m. ADA McKinley states there has been negotiations. Does not know the status. Atty Harrelson has received the courts written decision. Still no agreement. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF388 and 14CF455:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Curtis Steven Korn appeared. Case called at 11:04 a.m. Atty Harrelson does not have a copy of the original information but reviewed a copy of the state's. 15CF388 will be heard for arraignment for today. Court reads charges and penalties. Atty Harrelson enters NG plea on all 3 charges. Waives further reading. Waives speedy trial. Address confirmed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 09-08-2015 10:30 am

14CF455 and 15CF388
  CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk:Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Curtis Steven Korn appeared. Case called at 11:00 a.m. ADA McKinley requests court to take judicial notice of original bond in 14CF455. Atty Harrelson does not object to the court taking judicial notice. Court will take judicial notice of bond in 14CF455. State calls Officer Balow to the stand. S/T Officer Adam Balow with New Richmond P.D. Direct by ADA McKinley. Officer Balow identifies defendant in the courtroom. Court notes ID of defendant. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA McKinley. Recross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused at 11:13 a.m. No further witnesses by either party. Atty Harrelson gives argument of self defense. Court at this time finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. No request for modifications for bond. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.

per Defendant in court. eif
Preliminary hearing at 09-02-2015 11:00 am

-Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Andrew H., Topper Brown or Trooper Wright, families or the residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Not to use or possess firearms.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson for today,  DF:  Curtis Steven Korn appeared. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Prelim demanded. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.
